body:
Of 41 ECIPs (draft + last call + final + active):

• 9 use copyright/license CC0
• 2 use copyright/license Apache 2.0
• 30 have no license

Of the 9 that used CC0, they are 7 different authors who used it. One author used Apache 2.0 for 2 ECIPs.

I suspect the 30 which have no license it's because ETC was very disorganized before and the ECIP-X which is generally used as a template did not have a #Copyright/Licensing section by default so all authors omitted that detail.

I still don't see any rationale to establish a root license instead of the options given in ECIP-1000.

It is, from now on, according to ECIP-1000, a function of editors to actually supervise that authors include a copyright/license from the options.

I do agree to seek all past authors to add a license to their past ECIPs, I can do that. This is the doc with the stats: 

https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1mnpm8FC33dT4eKefDDMTIl2jPAKRrGvkQNPwDk3TUos/edit?usp=sharing

![ECIPs and licensing](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29529586/68310151-bfa5bf00-006c-11ea-8e91-38e8efab5a17.png)
